intro: Habenaria lykipiensis, commonly known as the Lykipi Orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the island of Lykípia in Greece. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its inflorescence consists of several showy, white to pale pink flowers with a distinctive lip. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
